metadata.name: Subscription
metadata.description:
Subscription

A named resource representing the stream of messages from a single, specific {Topic}, to be delivered to the subscribing application.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

sub = pubsub.subscription "my-topic-sub"
msgs = sub.pull
msgs.each { |msg| msg.acknowledge! }

metadata.name: topic
metadata.description: The {Topic} from which this subscription receives messages.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

sub = pubsub.subscription "my-topic-sub"
sub.topic.name #=> "projects/my-project/topics/my-topic"

metadata.name: deadline
metadata.description: This value is the maximum number of seconds after a subscriber receives a message before the subscriber should acknowledge the message.

metadata.name: endpoint
metadata.description: Returns the URL locating the endpoint to which messages should be pushed.

metadata.name: endpoint=
metadata.description: Sets the URL locating the endpoint to which messages should be pushed.

metadata.name: exists?
metadata.description: Determines whether the subscription exists in the Pub/Sub service.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

sub = pubsub.subscription "my-topic-sub"
sub.exists? #=> true

metadata.name: delete
metadata.description: Deletes an existing subscription. All pending messages in the subscription are immediately dropped.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

sub = pubsub.subscription "my-topic-sub"
sub.delete

returns.description: Returns true if the subscription was deleted.

metadata.name: pull
metadata.description: Pulls messages from the server. Returns an empty list if there are no messages available in the backlog. Raises an ApiError with status UNAVAILABLE if there are too many concurrent pull requests pending for the given subscription.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

sub = pubsub.subscription "my-topic-sub"
sub.pull.each { |msg| msg.acknowledge! }

examples.caption: A maximum number of messages returned can also be specified:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

sub = pubsub.subscription "my-topic-sub", max: 10
sub.pull.each { |msg| msg.acknowledge! }

examples.caption: The call can block until messages are available:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

sub = pubsub.subscription "my-topic-sub"
msgs = sub.pull immediate: false
msgs.each { |msg| msg.acknowledge! }

params.name: immediate
params.description: When true the system will respond immediately even if it is not able to return messages. When false the system is allowed to wait until it can return least one message. No messages are returned when a request times out. The default value is true.

params.name: max
params.description: The maximum number of messages to return for this request. The Pub/Sub system may return fewer than the number specified. The default value is 100, the maximum value is 1000.

params.name: autoack
params.description: Automatically acknowledge the message as it is pulled. The default value is false.

metadata.name: wait_for_messages
metadata.description:
Pulls from the server while waiting for messages to become available. This is the same as:

subscription.pull immediate: false

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

sub = pubsub.subscription "my-topic-sub"
msgs = sub.wait_for_messages
msgs.each { |msg| msg.acknowledge! }

params.name: max
params.description: The maximum number of messages to return for this request. The Pub/Sub system may return fewer than the number specified. The default value is 100, the maximum value is 1000.

params.name: autoack
params.description: Automatically acknowledge the message as it is pulled. The default value is false.

metadata.name: listen
metadata.description: Poll the backend for new messages. This runs a loop to ping the API, blocking indefinitely, yielding retrieved messages as they are received.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

sub = pubsub.subscription "my-topic-sub"
sub.listen do |msg|
  # process msg
end

examples.caption: Limit the number of messages pulled per batch with max:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

sub = pubsub.subscription "my-topic-sub"
sub.listen max: 20 do |msg|
  # process msg
end

examples.caption: Automatically acknowledge messages with autoack:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

sub = pubsub.subscription "my-topic-sub"
sub.listen autoack: true do |msg|
  # process msg
end

params.name: max
params.description: The maximum number of messages to return for this request. The Pub/Sub system may return fewer than the number specified. The default value is 100, the maximum value is 1000.

params.name: autoack
params.description: Automatically acknowledge the message as it is pulled. The default value is false.

params.name: delay
params.description: The number of seconds to pause between requests when the Google Cloud service has no messages to return. The default value is 1.

params.name: yield
params.description: a block for processing new messages

metadata.name: acknowledge
metadata.description: Acknowledges receipt of a message. After an ack, the Pub/Sub system can remove the message from the subscription. Acknowledging a message whose ack deadline has expired may succeed, although the message may have been sent again. Acknowledging a message more than once will not result in an error. This is only used for messages received via pull.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

sub = pubsub.subscription "my-topic-sub"
messages = sub.pull
sub.acknowledge messages

params.name: *messages
params.description:
One or more {ReceivedMessage}
objects or ack_id values.

metadata.name: delay
metadata.description:
Modifies the acknowledge deadline for messages.

This indicates that more time is needed to process the messages, or to make the messages available for redelivery if the processing was interrupted.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

sub = pubsub.subscription "my-topic-sub"
messages = sub.pull
sub.delay 120, messages

params.name: new_deadline
params.description: The new ack deadline in seconds from the time this request is sent to the Pub/Sub system. Must be >= 0. For example, if the value is 10, the new ack deadline will expire 10 seconds after the call is made. Specifying 0 may immediately make the message available for another pull request.

params.name: *messages
params.description:
One or more {ReceivedMessage}
objects or ack_id values.

metadata.name: policy
metadata.description:
Gets the access control policy.

By default, the policy values are memoized to reduce the number of API calls to the Pub/Sub service.

examples.caption: Policy values are memoized to reduce the number of API calls:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

subscription = pubsub.subscription "my-subscription"
puts subscription.policy["bindings"]
puts subscription.policy["rules"]

examples.caption: Use force to retrieve the latest policy from the service:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

subscription = pubsub.subscription "my-subscription"
policy = subscription.policy force: true

params.name: force
params.description: Force the latest policy to be retrieved from the Pub/Sub service when true. Otherwise the policy will be memoized to reduce the number of API calls made to the Pub/Sub service. The default is false.

params.name: new_policy

metadata.name: test_permissions
metadata.description: Tests the specified permissions against the Cloud IAM access control policy.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub
sub = pubsub.subscription "my-subscription"
perms = sub.test_permissions "projects.subscriptions.list",
                             "projects.subscriptions.pull"
perms.include? "projects.subscriptions.list" #=> true
perms.include? "projects.subscriptions.pull" #=> false

params.name: *permissions
params.description: The set of permissions to check access for. Permissions with wildcards (such as * or storage.*) are not allowed.

metadata.name: ensure_connection!
metadata.description: Raise an error unless an active connection is available.

metadata.name: coerce_ack_ids
metadata.description: Makes sure the values are the ack_id. If given several {ReceivedMessage} objects extract the ack_id values.
